Recently we uncovered an unknown APT in the RU-UA conflict that involved use of #PowerMagic & #CommonMagic implants. 

We dug deeper and identified a cluster of even more sophisticated activities from the same threat actor we dubbed #CloudWizard üëâ https://t.co/lt803s0bah https://t.co/P6G5oHEsTm

Interestingly th—É decryption DLL has a an incorrect implementation and we found a GitHub gist of the code that has been likely borrowed by the implant‚Äôs developers. In the comments to this gist, GitHub users highlight the error https://t.co/JffZ0tp8oT

After obtaining #CloudWizard orchestrator, we were still missing the framework installer. With the older telemetry data we identified multiple installers used in 2017-20. This may indicate that the installer is used to deploy CloudWizard via physical access to target machines https://t.co/2CBfWgYlMe

So who's behind #CloudWizard?

The facts allow us to conclude with medium to high confidence that the CloudWizard framework is operated by the actor behind Operation Groundbait and Operation BugDrop. https://t.co/7d3vjetDiQ

What was most interesting about it is that its victims were located not only in the Donetsk, Lugansk and Crimea regions, but also in central and western Ukraine. Targets included individuals, as well as diplomatic and research organizations.

@vmyths @mikko good old times indeed

Did you know that ~3% of incidents on OT-computers is caused by... computer viruses? Yes, the nasty Red-Listed malware from 90s that have died out years ago. *Almost* died out‚Ä¶ How so? [1/5] https://t.co/E6ompUfNP4
@0x09AL Unfortunately yes. And it still causes problems in ICS

So, OT is OTT-conservative. Uninterrupted operation is paramount, so anything new and unknown (might it cause interruptions?) is feared like the plague. But we‚Äôve got something that changes all that. Let me tell you all about it üëâ https://t.co/U6Jdde60so [5/5] https://t.co/e9dleKVtOG

3% doesn‚Äôt sound like much, but‚Ä¶ it represents *thousands* of instances of critical infrastructure around the world. Such a shame when you think how such risk could be excluded fully, simply, and with the most fundamental of methods [4/5]

The % shown above relate to a ‚Äúsleeping‚Äù phase for these old-school viruses. But from time to time they escape the bounds of a single infected system and spread across the whole network ‚Äì leading to a serious local epidemic. [3/5]

The answer is obvious: OT ‚Äì rather, its application in industry ‚Äì is very conservative. If there were ever a market that firmly believes in the old axiom ‚Äúif it ain‚Äôt broke, don‚Äôt fix it!‚Äù, Upgrades, updates are all looked upon with skepticism, if not scorn ‚Äì if not fear! [2/5]
